nodes.text: Travel providers should absolutely not be allowed to advertise a "oneway" price when a roundtrip purchase is required.
keithanywhere(455): Travel providers should absolutely not be allowed to advertise a "oneway" price when a roundtrip purchase is required.
Annot: Travel providers should absolutely not be allowed to advertise a "oneway" price when a roundtrip purchase is required.
That's like a store advertising the price of one sneaker!
keithanywhere(455): That's like a store advertising the price of one sneaker!
Annot: That's like a store advertising the price of one sneaker!
Well, obviously you have to buy two sneakers so why would a store advertise the price for just one.
keithanywhere(455): Well, obviously you have to buy two sneakers so why would a store advertise the price for just one.
Annot: Well, obviously you have to buy two sneakers so why would a store advertise the price for just one.
Likewise, travel providers should clearly display the roundtrip cost IF a roundtrip purchase is required to obtain that fare.
keithanywhere(455): Likewise, travel providers should clearly display the roundtrip cost IF a roundtrip purchase is required to obtain that fare.
Annot: Likewise, travel providers should clearly display the roundtrip cost IF a roundtrip purchase is required to obtain that fare.
It makes no sense and is misleading to quote a one way price if I have to buy a roundtrip ticket.
darawayne(1071): It makes no sense and is misleading to quote a one way price if I have to buy a roundtrip ticket.
Annot: It makes no sense and is misleading to quote a one way price if I have to buy a roundtrip ticket.
If the itemization is Boston to Bombay fare, then various fees, then Bombay to Boston fare and various fees, it is still misleading unless it is specifically preceded by "Round Trip Required"

darawayne(1071): If the itemization is Boston to Bombay fare, then various fees, then Bombay to Boston fare and various fees, it is still misleading unless it is specifically preceded by "Round Trip Required"
Annot: If the itemization is Boston to Bombay fare, then various fees, then Bombay to Boston fare and various fees, it is still misleading unless it is specifically preceded by "Round Trip Required"
If I just want to go from Boston to Bombay and stay there or go  somewhere else, I shouldn't buy this ticket and I should know it "up front."
darawayne(1071): If I just want to go from Boston to Bombay and stay there or go  somewhere else, I shouldn't buy this ticket and I should know it "up front."
Annot: If I just want to go from Boston to Bombay and stay there or go  somewhere else, I shouldn't buy this ticket and I should know it "up front."
